portfolioThesis.title: Geopolitical Alpha - Defense & Energy Arbitrage
portfolioThesis.summary: Capitalizing on geopolitical tensions through defense contractors, energy infrastructure, and strategic commodity exposure. Markets systematically underprice defense spending increases and energy supply disruptions during escalating conflicts.
coreBeliefs: Middle East tensions drive sustained defense spending increases globally
Energy infrastructure investments accelerate due to supply chain vulnerabilities
Defense contractors benefit from multi-year procurement cycles (2-5 year lag)
Small futures allocation (1-2%) provides tactical commodity exposure
Regional conflicts correlate with defense/aerospace outperformance vs broad indices
edgeSources: Early positioning based on geopolitical risk model signals
Defense contractor earnings visibility from prediction market positions
Energy supply disruption analysis from real-time news intelligence
Futures curve analysis for commodity trade timing with strict position limits
portfolioThesis.riskManagement: Conservative portfolio (97% deployed) with sector diversification. Position sizing: 8-20% per holding. Commission-free stock trading. Futures limited to 1% of portfolio ($1k margin). Stop losses on all positions. Contract rolls managed 5-7 days before expiry. Total commissions YTD: $28.
portfolioThesis.performanceAttribution: Defense sector +$4.5k (RTX +$0.9k, LMT +$0.3k, NOC +$1.1k, BA +$1.1k, ITA +$0.5k). Energy mixed +$0.4k (XLE +$0.5k, oil futures -$0.6k). S&P hedge -$1.1k. Closed trades +$0.6k realized. Commissions -$28. Significant underperformance vs S&P due to defensive positioning and small oil loss.

positions.name: RTX Corporation (Raytheon)
positions.reasoning: Patriot missile system orders from Middle East allies. Q2 earnings beat on international defense sales. Pentagon FY26 budget +$2.8B for missile defense. Zero commission.

positions.name: Lockheed Martin
positions.reasoning: F-35 production ramp, THAAD systems to Middle East. South China Sea tensions boost Pacific allies orders (Japan, Australia). Zero commission.

positions.name: Northrop Grumman
positions.reasoning: B-21 Raider bomber program accelerating, space defense contracts. Taiwan contingency planning drives unmanned systems demand. Zero commission.

positions.name: Boeing
positions.reasoning: Defense segment undervalued vs pure-plays. Apache helicopters, P-8 Poseidon maritime patrol demand. Commercial recovery secondary thesis. Zero commission.

positions.name: Energy Select Sector SPDR Fund
positions.reasoning: Middle East supply disruption risk premium. Iran-Saudi tensions, Red Sea shipping threatened. Energy stocks diversification vs direct commodity exposure. Zero commission.

positions.name: Crude Oil Futures (WTI)
positions.reasoning: Small tactical bet (0.77% portfolio) on Iran-Israel escalation premium - WRONG. OPEC+ production increase, China demand weak. Down $7.31/bbl (-10.7%). $2.94 from stop loss. Commission: $9 total. Thesis broken - candidate for exit before Dec 13 roll to avoid $4.50 roll cost.
positions.exitConsideration: Thesis invalidated. No Iran-Israel escalation materialized. Bearish fundamentals (OPEC+ production up, China demand weak). Close to stop loss ($2.94). Roll in 25 days costs $4.50 - not worth holding broken thesis.

positions.name: iShares US Aerospace & Defense ETF
positions.reasoning: Broad defense sector exposure, lower idiosyncratic risk. Geopolitical model signaling sustained defense spending cycle. Diversification vs single stock concentration. Zero commission.

positions.name: General Dynamics
positions.reasoning: Columbia-class submarine program, Abrams tank upgrades for Eastern Europe. Gulfstream business jet recovering. Lower beta defensive play. Zero commission.

positions.name: SPDR S&P Oil & Gas Exploration ETF
positions.reasoning: Small-cap energy producers levered to oil price recovery. Venezuela crisis reducing Western Hemisphere supply. Permian Basin production constraints. Zero commission.

positions.name: Huntington Ingalls Industries
positions.reasoning: Naval shipbuilding monopoly. South China Sea tensions driving destroyer/carrier orders. Multi-year backlog visibility. Virginia-class submarine ramp. Zero commission.

positions.name: SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SHORT)
positions.reasoning: Portfolio hedge (15% short exposure vs 85% long defense/energy). Negative correlation to defense. Losing on market rally but provides downside protection. Zero commission short sale.
